turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Tredegar.
turn.1: What was the start of the Industrial Revolution in Tredegar?
turn.2: They developed it as the first coal fired furnace, so men were employed to dig coal at Bryn Bach and Nantybwch, the first small scale coal mining operation in the area.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The furnace and hence the business failed in 1794.
turn.6: In 1797, Samuel Homfray, with partners Richard Fothergill and the Matthew Monkhouse built a new furnace, leasing the land from the Tredegar Estate in Newport.
turn.8: This created the new Sirhowy Ironworks, that were in 1800 to become the Tredegar Iron Company, named in honour of the Tredegar Estate at Tredegar House and Tredegar Park in Newport in the south of the county.
turn.10: In 1891, the company ceased production of iron, but continued to develop coal mines and produce coal.
turn.11: Is there anything else that happened after that?
turn.12: The former Tredegar Ironworks were effectively abandoned, with Whiteheads taking over the southern section of the site from 1907.
